title: Data Analyst
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
About HP & RPB

HP is the world’s leading personal systems and printing company, we create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. Our innovation springs from a team of individuals, each collaborating and contributing their own perspectives, knowledge, and experience to advance the way the world works and lives.

The HP Replacement Parts Business (RPB) is part of Customer Support organization, and our mission is to support the Right-To-Repair movement by removing the barriers denying consumers the ability to maintain, repair and upgrade their HP Print and PC products.

Job Role

As RPB Business intelligence & Data analyst you will shape RPB’s future with how we market our products. We are a very dynamic, highly skilled, and diverse global team consisting of engineers, project managers, and product owners, among other roles. Working with us you will combine your analytical and coding skills to enable RPB business growth.

The ideal candidate has strong data analysis and business acumen, but more important, it is a self-starter with the ability to build reports from scratch and provide data analysis and business insights to key stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities
In accordance with plan and team guidance, performs/executes data collection, analysis procedures and data insight visualizations for assigned projects.Leverage data analytics techniques and visualization tools like Excel and PowerBI to reconcile, analyze and transform raw data into meaningful insights.Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.Analyze and work on improvement plans with the business/users.Present the results and recommendations to the project team and contribute to the action plan for improvements.Develop and implement frameworks and processes to make your analyses and algorithms easily replicable, scalable, and automated.
About You
You are interested in making a career in a multicultural company within a business in massive expansion.You are interested in customer and market behavior and methods to measure and anticipate it.You are a data driven person, with a passion to identify patterns in the data, identify the root cause, and propose solutions.You are passionate about coding, simplifying the complex, automation and making processes more efficient.You are not afraid of having visibility to internal customers and meeting their expectations.
Required Skills
Extensive knowledge of PowerBI & DAX is required as well as MS Excel. SQL Server is desirable. It is also preferable to be familiar with data warehousing, data mining, and data mapping.Programming/automation orientation.High attention to details.Excellent analytical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Organized, structured and good housekeeping skill when handing data.Teamwork collaboration but able to work independently.
Education And Experience Required
Bachelor's degree in information system, engineering, or equivalent experience.Less than 3 months extracurricular experience.Excellent English skills, written and spoken.
About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Data Engineer
description:
What is Exoticca?Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like strong challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!
Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of voyages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places in our planet, though the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. For more comfort, our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies.
At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of 140+ people, in rapid international growth, seeking for new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation. 
We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Glovo, SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.

What about the Data team?At Exoticca, the Data team is the main responsible of making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vasts amount of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking, to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to deliver unparalleled product & services, that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.
Join us as a Data Engineer in order to achieve such ambitious goals, our Data team works together with other departments, such as Marketing, Flight Product, Travel Product, Sales or Customer Experience, to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver and convert them into actual company initiatives, business decisions, or product features. There are a myriad of opportunities for using data to learn more about our customers, to grow sales, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can’t wait to have you on board!
Which will be your main responsibilities?Be part of a team that takes end-to-end responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining batch & real-time data pipelines and data solutions.Create solutions to enable diagnostic and predictive analytics capabilities.Research, evaluate, and propose different data solutions in an agnostic way.Select, setup and manage tools & technologies to build and support a robust data infrastructure.Propose and help decide on the data modeling and schema design of our data stores.

Which are the job requirements?2+ years of work experience in a similar role as a Data Engineer.Experience working with Python.Experience with relational databases , data warehouses, data lakes and data marts.Familiarity with cloud-based, distributed systems and orchestrated ETL processes (AWS is preferred).Experience in data management, integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, including internal DBs and APIs.Fluency in English.
Benefits:Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience.Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance, and personal training purposes.Hybrid work model/full remote: you can work from home or the office at your convenience. Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Plaça Catalunya).Permanent contract from the start.Travel packages at reduced prices!.Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you.Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lessons.And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!.
Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Overview
Data Quality Analyst is a part of global transformational program which is fundamentally evolving our planning and reporting capabilities. This position will play a critical role in the success of the PepsiCo designed Mosaic program. Mosaic is transforming the way FP&A teams work across PepsiCo and the level of financial information available for the senior leadership teams.
The Analyst will be responsible for the development and execution of data quality plan, the understanding of data sources, systems, data flow to the solution and communication and explanation of business requirements to the IT teams, local markets support with any issues arising on master data front.
Responsibilities
Ensure Core Model is up to date with latest definitions (functional, global and regional).Align dimensions/elements with different business functions.Evaluate and understand link between dataset increasing potential business insights.Collaborate closely with IT/ Strategy & Transformation teams to ensure business requirements from Mosaic leads and Sector FP&A teams are well-understood and translated into the design.Gain knowledge on how data is being “consumed” by the end-users (support them with necessary training).Own full suite of master data sets used in financial planning (Product, Customer, GL, Cost Center).Present process understanding and monitor the data quality across markets.Provide guidance and help in getting local markets ready for data standardisation regardless of the origin and size of their data.Drive data quality improvements to ensure appropriate reporting capabilities are delivered as part of the project.
Qualifications
Previous experience in a similar position.Technical competencies across a variety of software (i.e. Tableau, Alteryx, SAP, Oracle, Power Steering, TM1 & Cognos).Familiarity with technical database structures and hierarchy.Ability to structure highly complex concepts into simple execution.Expertise and knowledge of database management principles and applications.Ability to navigate complex and varied processes across multiple markets.Willingness to engage at all levels of the organization.Strong written and verbal English.

title: Data Analyst
description:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.
Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive and Proton Pass give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.
Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times , some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 100 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, Paris, Barcelona and many more employees working remotely around the world.
Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.
Purpose of the role
We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.
What You Will Do
Lead colleagues to the right decision by using dataAssemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sourcesApply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualizationRepresent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate formatResearch new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporatedCollaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unitShare findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.Strong analytical skillsExperience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analyticsat least 3 years of relevant working experience in the fieldAdvanced knowledge of SQLGood knowledge of a BI tool, preferably TableauGood knowledge of Python is a plusOpen-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas
Why should you join Proton?
Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.
Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

title: Senior Product Data Analyst
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world’s largest online travel companies and one of the largest European e-commerce businesses. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for the more than 18 million customers it serves across 43 markets. eDreams ODIGEO is listed in the Spanish Stock Market.
Our Experiments and Insights team is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment.
We are looking for a Senior Product Data Analyst who has experience working with analytics tools such as SQL (mostly for BigQuery usage) and preferably also R/Python, visualization tools as LookerStudio; that has a strong statistics knowledge and experience in statistics applied to AB testing or experimentation.
In this role, you would be performing as a product data analyst (tasks are described below) to support a set of product teams, but you will be also part of the next experimentation generation at eDreams ODIGEO. The team is constantly investigating best in class methodologies and processes to implement in our business/analysis and tests, which means you will be required to apply your mathematical knowledge in some strategic projects that are focused on taking more accurate decisions maintaining a strong statistical confidence level.
Your will be working with multi-disciplinary teams - Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers - to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.
Main responsibilities (included but not limited to):
 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products;  Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams;  Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc,  Data cleaning and validation,  Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions);  Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using Data Studio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;  Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge;  Responsabile for one or more team’s projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools;  Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps. 
NOTE: Data you will be using could come from Google Analytics API or Googe Analytics tables in BigQuery, other sources of data stored in BigQuery such as internal databases, customer service database, etc as well as our data stored and accessible in Microstrategy.
Skills and Experience:
 Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),  Minimum of 6 years experience in a role with strong analytical component,  Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the followings: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/…  Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing,  Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data,  R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation),  Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc),  Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview,  Business Proficiency in English,  A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun! 
Plus:
 Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.),  Previous experience in programming,  Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform. 
 What we offer: 
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Learning Platform.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
… And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Operations Intern
description:
Description

Wallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.

Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 1K Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!

We’re the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE and have been recently named among LinkedIn’s top 3 Spanish startups.

At Wallbox you come first, so we offer a tailored career plan that aligns with your professional goals.

Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible, and top-performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!

The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?

You will:
Manage all users in our tools like Snowflake, Databricks and Tableau (creating and removing users, assigning proper permissions)Ensure that our data warehouse models have the proper tagging for security, criticality, ownership and privacy issuesAdd new data sources to our data warehouse either via Fivetran/Airbyte or Google Sheets and document themMonitor our platform costs on a weekly basis to detect unexpected issues and propose optimizations Review all incoming requests coming through our Service Desk portal and do a first triage to refine them and forward them to the appropriate team memberReview all runtime and test errors and do a first triage to identify the root cause and solve it or forward to the appropriate team member

Requirements

Must:
Academic background in Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar.Hands-on and basic-to-medium knowledge of SQLBe comfortable with one or more common scripting languages (Python - preferably, Bash).Basic knowledge of GitEnglish is a must

Nice to have:
Experience with a BI tool like Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik or LookerExperience with an issue tracking system like JiraExperience with Amazon Web Services/Google Cloud PlatformExperience with task orchestration tools (ex.Airflow, Luigi)Experience working with a modern data warehouse (Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or similar).Be familiar with software development best practices and their applications to analytics (version control, testing, CI/CD, automation).Experience with data modelling in DBT (or similar)Experience with GitLab CI or Github actionsExperience with data quality frameworks

Benefits
Internship agreement of six months with the opportunity extend based on performance.Flexible working hoursHybrid workFriday´s afternoons off!Unlimited coffee to fuel your mornings.Monthly “All Hands” & other team events.International environment: Over 45 different nationalities.No suits! Unless it’s Carnival or Halloween.

Please submit your CV in English
At Wallbox, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

title: Consultor/a Data Analytics (100% remoto posible)
description:
En T-Systems somos un equipo de alrededor 28.000 personas en todo el mundo, convirtiéndonos en uno de los principales proveedores mundiales de soluciones integradas de extremo a extremo.En esta ocasión, queremos incorporar un/a especialista en procesos ETL y visualización de datos a nuestro equipo.🗺 Tendremos en cuenta candidaturas que se encuentren en cualquier punto de España. 👨‍💻¿Cuáles serán tus tareas?Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener procesos ETL con herramientas como SSIS, SSAS, SSRS y SQL Server.Diseñar los componentes visuales de la información contenida en el almacén de datos, con vistas a mejorar la experiencia de los usuarios en la visualización e interpretación del dato.Explotar las capacidades que ofrecen las herramientas de diseño de informes y los cuadros de mando.
🔎¿Qué buscamos?Unos tres años de experiencia con lenguajes SQL y herramientas ETL: Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services.Experiencia con cubos OLAP.Valoramos positivamente el conocimiento en Power BI y/u otras herramientas de reporting, así como en Azure.
🤲¿Qué ofrecemos?Contrato indefinidoFlexibilidad horariaSalario acorde a la experiencia y conocimientos aportadosFormación continuaPlan de Retribución Flexible: seguro médico, tickets restaurante, guardería, ayudas al transporte...Seguro de vida y accidentesMínimo de 27 días laborables de vacaciones anualesPago de facturas médicasServicio gratuito en especialistas (médicos, fisioterapeutas, nutricionistas, psicólogos, abogados...)Formación: certificaciones gratuitas, acceso a Coursera, clases semanales de inglés y alemán...100% del salario en caso de baja médica¡y muchas más ventajas por formar parte de T-Systems!
¡Únete a nuestro equipo! ¡Ven al lado magenta!
"T-Systems Iberia solo tratará los CVs de quienes reúnan los requisitos especificados para cada oferta."

title: Data Engineer - Hybrid Intelligence
description:
The RoleHybrid Intelligence, a Capgemini Engineering team, is looking for a Data Engineer to join the team in Spain. You will provide analytics experience to a highly talented team, while participating in the rapid growth and expansion of our client base.
Requirements· +5 years of experience with large scale cloud-based data technologies such as AWS ELT environment, S3, Glue, RedShift, Lambda, Python/ PySpark etc.· Knowledge of informatics, Data modeling and architecture concepts, analytics, data science, service management, delivery· SQL, NoSQL and RDBMS databases· Data modeling and ELT / ETL· Operate with CI/CD and Agile standard framework· Understanding of Data analytics and visualization· Solid communication skills and team player· Professional level ability in Spanish and English.Desirable: list any desirable skills or experience – the ‘nice to haves’· Supplier management exposure· Data analyst experience· Data science and visualization experience· AWS data certification is a plusMinimum education and critical knowledge required for the job:· Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in informatics, computer science, or related fieldsExperience in Big Data tools, cloud ELT infrastructure, analytics, and visualization nice to haveExposure to cross-functional / organizational / geography multi-cultural people and teams
About UsAs a member of the Hybrid Intelligence team of Capgemini Engineering you will work on a variety of innovative and rewarding projects that make a difference. Our work is a fusion of applied mathematics, scientific computing, AI, and software engineering. We deliver ground-breaking, multi-disciplinary solutions for our R&D-driven clients tackling humanity’s generational challenges, from discovering new drug treatments to harnessing green energy.We are dedicated to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate individuals for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the workplace.Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. It is a multicultural company of over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Description
Coniq is a dynamic, high growth UK-based SaaS company that provides total customer engagement and loyalty services to many of the world’s leading property developers, shopping centers and retailers. Coniq powers well over £1 billion of sales annually for its clients, with more than 20 million consumers shopping at 1,800 brands in 24 countries worldwide, and has offices in Europe, the US and the Middle East.
We are looking for a Data Engineer. The role will be responsible for maintaining, optimising and extending our enterprise MySQL databases, peripheral database systems (RDBS and Data warehouse), and data pipeline operations (ETL/ELT management), to sustain our current operational data needs, and to enable Coniq’s continued growth. Coniq leads the world in providing shopper engagement and loyalty solutions for the most advanced retail destinations and we are looking for talented individuals to join us on our journey.
Ideally, we would like this role to be based in Barcelona to spend some time with our team in the office, however, we’re open for this role to be remote in Spain.
Reports to Head of Data Operations.
Responsibilities
Maintenance, development and expanding of multiple MySQL databases and data warehousesEnsuring data management systems health and performanceCreating and optimising queries for data analysis and day-to-day data operations required by Coniq’s applicationsSupporting Data Analysts to transform client data requirements into executable queriesSynchronising data between data sources (MySQL, 3rd Partydata sources, etc.) and data store systems (MySQL, Exasol, etc.)Supporting the application development team to build, validate and optimise database interactionsMaintaining processes to ensure failover and disaster recoverySupporting the development team with data operations to facilitate software deployments
Relevant experience
You have managed a high volume, high performance MySQL database in a multi-tenancy, SaaS environment.You are highly proficient in creating, optimising and maintaining SQL queries and processes - including triggers and stored procedures.Database health and performance is central to your thinking and work - you have experience of performance tuning, optimising and partitioning data in conjunction with analysing query performance.You have designed and maintained processes to replicate data into redundant databases and into read-replica sets - including into different database systems.You have supported an application development team to ensure that all data operations are optimal to the needs of the business.You have an experience working with columnar and non-relational databasesYou have experience modeling and management of ETL/ELT processes on data flow systems; such as airflow, azkaban etc.; between tabular databases and data warehousesYou have scripting experience in Python, bash or similar scripting language
Requirements
Proactive problem solverAble to work independently, identifying problems and solutions and planning for future improvementAble to work with stakeholders that are not data expertsExcellent attention to detailHighly proficient and experienced in any Native SQL - experience of MySQL dialect essentialUnderstanding of Enterprise Queues and pipelinesUnderstanding of APIsA strong understanding of agile methodologiesProficient in Python scripting or similar scripting languageDesirable:Experience maintaining non-relational and columnar databases - Exasol, ElasticSearch, NoSQL etcPerformance tuning and data partitioningKnowledge on data infrastructures and architectures - Hybrid, SMACK, etc.

Benefits
We offer a generous package, including:Competitive salaryCompany stock options25 days holiday plus statutory holidaysA day off to celebrate your birthdayA day off for your wellbeingShorter working hours on FridaysA strong company values framework, including paid leave for volunteering with approved charitiesRegular team building activitiesTraining & development allowanceNew employee referral schemeThis is a unique opportunity to join a VC-funded high growth SaaS business where we all share a passion to work together to build a great product and a great company. We are proud of our company culture and invest a great deal into making sure that we promote Diversity in the workplace. Together we come from over 20 nationalities and as a tech business, we are very proud of the 50/50 gender split.

title: Data Analytics Trainee
description:
Our opportunity 

Would you like to start your professional career in a multinational environment?

If you’re someone who wants to influence your own development, if you are passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a young and motivated team and help us make a difference, this is your program! We are seeking recent graduates, who are interested in developing their professional career in one of the world’s leading insurance groups through a personalized training and development program.

 The Data Analytics Trainee Program  offers you the experience to learn within an international environment providing you support, mentoring and development opportunities in new projects.

In this 2-year trainee program, you will be part of the Reporting and Analytics Team within Group Investment Management.

 Your role 

 As a  Data Analytics Trainee   your main responsibilities will involve 

 Design and implement solutions based on data & analytics in Investment Management  Enable the business to draw actionable insights out of complex data sets  Translate reporting requirements into business intelligence solutions 

Your role will involve building relationships with:

 Stakeholders on local, regional and group levels  Investment back-office and middle-office teams  Market and Master Data teams  IT teams 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Data Analytics Trainee your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 Bachelor or Master´s degree in either Finance, Economics, Information Technology and/or quantitative fields such as Statistics and Math with good academic record  Fluent in written and spoken English (Spanish is a plus)  Experience with data engineering and analysis  Experience with visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) would be considered an asset  Practical experience with data analysis  Strong coding skills (preferably Python, Spark)  Proven analytical and problem-solving skills  Databricks knowledge is a plus  Skills in Microsoft tools is a plus  Ability to work with multi-cultural project teams and facilitating workshops with stakeholders  Excellent communication and presentation skills  Creative thinking and intellectual curiosity 

The following areas of knowledge would be very helpful to a candidate to successfully fulfil this role:

 Strong knowledge of data analytics including data transformation, modelling, and visualization  Business Analyst skills (e.g., requirement engineering, design thinking)  Understanding of financial products, financial markets as well as the main accounting principles 

Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

 Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Collective Life Retirement Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

 Diversity & Inclusion 

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .

 Location(s): ES - Barcelona  Remote working: Hybrid  Schedule: Full Time  Recruiter name: Maria Sol Besteiro Cerda

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
R00201258
As a part of the Digital Capabilities team in the Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.
Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!
Main ResponsibilitiesServe as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes Develop and maintain data productsDevelop, test, and operationalize new standardized reportingDevelop and maintain business intelligence dashboards Lead automation of processes and analysesTrain other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADSProactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reportingInterface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines
Basic Qualifications
Interest in an analytical or business intelligence roleExperience with data visualization and presenting insights to key stakeholdersExceptional analytical and problem-solving abilitiesProficient in MS Office suiteIntermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learnIntermediate DAX skills, or willingness to learn
Preferred Qualifications
Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboardsHistory of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiativesAbility to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environmentTraining or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysisExperience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SASExperience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertiseMicrosoft PowerBI experienceProject management experienceExperience in the petrochemical industry a plusEnrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.
In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
¿Tienes experiencia con el análisis de datos? ¿Buscas nuevos retos en una empresa en la que puedas crecer profesionalmente? Si la respuesta es si, ha llegado el momento de dar el salto, de emprender un cambio profesional, para ello te presentamos esta oportunidad.
Caixa Bank, gran empresa del sector bancario que está en continuo crecimiento apuesta por el desarrollo y la innovación.
Responsabilidades:· Gestión de la relación con los clientes (dirección y áreas de negocio)· Priorización de los proyectos· Timminos de entrega· Realización de proyectos en los que se aborda el ciclo completo de análisis de información:· Exploración de datos en Datapool y/o fuentes externas· Construcción de las extracciones de datos· Propuesta y generación de KPIs· Construcción de los informes / análisis para presentar la información· Presentar la información a los clientes· Automatización los procesos para seguimientos recurrentes o actualización de las peticiones
Conocimientos, habilidades y experiencia previa:· Licenciatura/máster en carreras técnicas (ciencias o ingenierías)· Otras carreras con formación en matemáticas/estadística
Competencias:· SQL (se valorará PL-SQL)· SAS· Qlik Sense· Python· Microsoft Office Avanzado (Se valorará VBA)
Experiencia:· Gestión de proyectos de información (relación con clientes y proveedores)· Mínima de 3 años en SQL/SAS
Requisitos deseados:· Buenas habilidades de comunicación e interpersonales· Buen nivel de inglés.· Se valorará positivamente haber trabajado bajo metodologías agile/scrum· Adaptabilidad· Compromiso· Proactivo· Autónomo· Responsabilidad· Resolutivo

title: Data Analyst Chapter Lead
description:
¿Eres un apasionado de la tecnología? ¿Te gustaría impulsar la transformación digital de grandes compañías y liderar sus retos de innovación? ¿Lo tuyo son los datos y el liderarazgo de equipos?
¡Te estamos buscando!
Nos presentamos… Somos Clevertask, una compañía de 200 profesionales, que pertenece al grupo internacional ALTEN, líder en ingeniería y servicios IT, con 55.000 consultores y presencia en 30 países. Contamos con la solidez de un gran grupo y la cercanía y expertise para ser en el mejor partner de nuestros clientes. Estamos especializados en tecnologías cloud, especialmente en el mundo Microsoft y Citrix, y trabajamos en la transformación digital, la definición soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras, y el desarrollo para nuestros clientes.
Nuestros servicios:
Consultoría estratégica tecnológicaTransformación del puesto de trabajo digitalMigración de infraestructuras al cloudImplantación de soluciones de seguridad cloudInteligencia Artificial y Machine Learning¿Nuestros valores? Transparencia, cercanía e innovación en todo lo que hacemos, sin olvidar la excelencia.
¿Qué ofrecemos?
En Clevertask ofrecemos una serie de medidas para que puedas desarrollarte 360º y conseguir todo aquello que te propongas, para ello tendrás la oportunidad de:
Horario flexible y posibilidad de trabajar en remoto (95% remoto, se puede requerir visitar oficinas en madrid muy puntualmente), como resultado de una mentalidad pro responsabilidad y autonomía.Plan de carrera personalizado, ara ello tendrás acceso a cursos de formación a cargo de la empresa y certificaciones oficiales.Clases de inglés en remoto sin coste para ti.Sistema de retribución flexible en guardería, transporte, seguro de salud y dietas.Referal bonus, si traes a gente con tanto talento como tú.Y lo mejor de todo, formar parte de una empresa donde tu eres la parte más importante y donde haremos todo para que puedas desarrollarte al máximo.¿Quieres saber más sobre nosotros? Te invitamos a echar un vistazo en los siguientes vídeos:
Presentación sobre quiénes somos y qué hacemos en Clevertask: https://www.linkedin.com/redir/invalid-link-page?url=https%3A%2F%2Facortar%2elink%2Fff4VHqNuestro 10º Aniversario: https://youtu.be/LmrwP3orYe8
REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:
¿Qué estamos buscando?
Buscamos a una persona con experiencia como Data Analyst Senior que además tenga experiencia y/o capacidades para liderar un equipo de unas 4-5 personas.
¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?
Responsable del Chapter de Data Analytics.Responsable técnico del chapter y del desarrollo de sus miembros.Contribuir a la entrega de valor como integrante de un squad (participarás en proyectos de clientes), y será el/la responsable jerárquico de los integrantes de un chapter (people manager).El/la líder del chapter garantiza que sus miembros tengan las competencias adecuadas mediante la mejora continua de sus habilidades y del área de especialización en su conjunto. Además, determina la forma de trabajar en su chapter e implementa el uso de estándares para el área de especialización junto con sus miembros.Imprescindible:
Data Analyst Sénior con al menos 5 años de experiencia en este rol.Conocimiento experto/a de Power BI.Desarrollo y optimización de modelos analíticos de datos (en Power BI o SS Analysis Services).Desarrollo avanzado de dashboards.Lenguajes de programación: M/Power Query, DAX y SQL.Gestión o coordinación de proyectos.Inglés nivel B2 o superior.Valorable:
Poseer la certificación PL-300 o equivalente (Power BI nivel Associate).Metodologías ágiles (Scrum o Kanban)Experiencia con otras soluciones de visualización (Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, …)SQL Server Analysis Services.Lenguajes de programación: MDX, R y Python.Desarrollo de objetos visuales personalizados (custom visuals).Power Automate.Machine Learning.Soft skills:
Jugador de equipo: Entender que, en equipo, 1+1=3.Tener mentalidad de crecimiento: Entender que nuestras cualidades y habilidades se desarrollan a través del esfuerzo continuo, la reflexión sobre nuestros errores, la práctica, afrontando desafíos, aprendiendo de las críticas e inspirándonos con los éxitos de los demás.Eficiente: Saber sacar el máximo partido con los mínimos recursos y entender que “lo mejor es enemigo de lo bueno”.Entusiasta: Demostrar el máximo interés e implicación en aquellos proyectos en los que participe.Empático/a y compasivo/a: Tener la habilidad de entender las experiencias y situaciones de otros, ya sean clientes o compañeros, y saber ponerse en su lugar.Divertido/a: Saber escoger el elemento de distensión que arranca una sonrisa del equipo.
¡Estamos deseando conocerte!Personas, equipos, proyectos. Todo empieza con la confianza.
#Greatpeople, #greatplace!

title: Data Insights Analyst - DCR
description:
Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?
We are looking for a results-oriented Data Insights Analyst to own, analyze and provide insights across the Schneider Electric Digital platforms supporting our Digital Transformation to become a “Leading with Data” company. In this role, you will work with Digital Customer Relationship -DCR colleagues as well as key stakeholders in the Business, Countries, customer type leads, functional owners and others. The Data Insights Analyst outcomes can bring “light to the unknown” and be core to our transformation providing understanding on customer journey and engagement that will help businesses make informed decisions.
What you will do:
Analyze our customers digital interactions to translate data into business understanding.Work alongside business teams or the management team to establish business needs around customer data from their engagements.Be competent at both challenging (where necessary) and providing insights around the strategic evolution of customer engagement to ensure that this aligns to our Strategic Priorities.Use data and visualizations to create insights that tell a story that is compelling to drive change. Appreciate the customer journey, interactions and subsequent impact of any change.Understand the several business services usage by our customers and look for innovative Insights that reveals actions that can be taken to improve our business.Regularly deliver actionable insights, analyses and recommendations that shape and inform day-to-day online strategies and long-term optimizationInfluence stakeholders in relation to proposed changes to improve our customers digital experience and drive adoption.Work collaboratively with both the Insights Analytics colleagues and key DCR stakeholders to drive adoption of recommendations (based on insights) and subsequent completion / successful implementationPromote a culture of data driven decision-making. 
Skills and experience we’re looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Business management, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, or other related technical field At least 2 years of relevant experience with data analysis tools and at least 2 years of relevant experience on analytical insightsAbility to collect and analyze website and customer data application metrics Working knowledge of Google Analytics, Contentsquare, Strong knowledge on Data Viz tools like Tableau, Looker, etc and creation of compelling content in PowerPoint.Good ETL/SQL Data retrieval skills/competenciesAbility to work independently and to proactively propose solutions while managing multiple projects simultaneously Analytical mind that translate to strong problem-solving skills and ability to investigate and resolve issues independently. Meticulosity with high attention to detail.Strong communication skills (verbal and written) with ability to write comprehensive reports with findings and proposed strategiesEasy to talk through data/technical details as well business layer details.
If you would like to have:
Exciting job in an international company, with opportunities to lead and contribute to different projects & actions (e.g. CSR, charity, Employer Branding, Well-Being) Work in a diverse and supportive team of professionalsBuddy, mentor & induction training - that will help you to smoothly find yourself in our companySpecial training tailored to your needs and career goalsNo formal dress code - we welcome people as they are and perceive diversity as value for the companyPossibility to use foreign languages and to collaborate with cross-region teamsWide choice of benefits 
Why us?
Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
€25.7bn global revenue
137 000+ employees in 100+ countries
45% of revenue from IoT
5% of revenue devoted for R&D
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: ES- DATA ANALYST (inglés alto)
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Devoteam es una consultora europea líder enfocada en estrategia digital, plataformas tecnológicas, ciberseguridad y transformación empresarial a través de la tecnología. Centrada en 6 áreas de especialización, abordamos los desafíos estratégicos de nuestros clientes: Digital Business & Products, Data-driven Intelligence, Distributed Cloud, Business Automation, Ciberseguridad y la Sostenibilidad conseguida por la Digitalización. La Tecnología está en nuestro ADN y creemos en ella como una palanca capaz de impulsar el cambio para mejorar, manteniendo un equilibrio que nos permite ofrecer a nuestros clientes herramientas tecnológicas de primer nivel pero siempre con la cercanía y profesionalidad de un equipo que actúa como guía durante el camino. Nuestros 25 años de experiencia nos convierten en una consultora innovadora, consolidada y madura que permite el desarrollo de nuestras 10000 personas, certificando continuamente a nuestros consultores en las últimas tecnologías y contando con expertos en: Cloud, BI, Data Analytics, Excelencia en Procesos de Negocio, Gestión de la Relación con clientes, Ciberseguridad, Marketing Digital, Machine Learning, Ingeniería y desarrollo del Software. Devoteam ha sido premiado como Partner del año 2021 de los 5 líderes de la nube: AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, Salesforce y ServiceNow. #CreativeTechForBetterChange




Descripción del empleo

Your responsibilities will be the following:

● Develop and maintain data pipelines / data models for the entire Devoteam Group on

selected platforms (Workday, SmartRecruiters, SalesForce, SAP, Semarchy, Whoz + others)

● Become the frontier of best practices and business logic from data entries across the system landscape to data validation

● Assist functional teams on development and automation of error handling process

● Maintain a scalable structure and lineage of our data lake, access distribution and data

pipelines

● Document the business logic and technical solutions to allow knowledge sharing

● Generally contribute on functional projects or ad-hoc technical issues




Requisitos

Qualifications

● 3+ years of experience within the Data Engineering domain

● A university degree within IT, Computer Science, Data science, or a related field

Technical

● Capabilities for ETL processes with low code tools or SQL, Python or equivalent (Alteryx is a plus)

● Experience with API, master data, data models and data lineage

● Experience with Data Warehousing (Snowflake is a plus)

● Experience with Front end visualisation tools and multidimensional or tabular models

(Tableau, Power BI)


Información adicional

● Interest in transforming a large organisation to become data driven

● Ability to explain complex technical concepts in a simple way

● Fluent in English

● Ability to project lead while developing. I.e take the loosely defined objectives and break them down into subtasks

● Structured, driven/proactive and high ability to problem solve, on process - or technical

issues.

● Ability to travel to France/Denmark approx 2 days/month

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
Join our dynamic consulting teams at Globalpraxis and embark on a thrilling journey towards business excellence. We are seeking talented individuals who are passionate about leveraging data science to unlock the full potential of top FMCG businesses. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact while gaining valuable experience that will lead to a full-time position with us if you meet our expectations!
Internship Details:Start date: ASAPLocation: Barcelona, SpainDuration: 6 months (with possibility of full-time position after completion)
Responsibilities: As an integral part of our project teams, you will collaborate closely with our experts to tackle diverse data challenges and immerse yourself in the daily operations of the project. Your key responsibilities will include:Acquiring, cleansing, and standardizing large-scale datasets.Designing and implementing powerful predictive algorithms for various scenarios.Conducting in-depth analyses of complex business scenarios.Generating actionable insights and user-friendly reports that empower our clients to harness the true potential of their data.Identifying new data sources and pioneering methods to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Requirements: To thrive in this role, we expect you to have the following qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering.Advanced proficiency in R and Python.Experience working with relational databases, including strong SQL query-building skills.Knowledge of PowerBI and JavaScript is considered a plus.Proficiency in English (other languages are a plus)
Desired Skills: In addition to the specific qualifications, we value the following skills and attributes:Strong analytical skills and a knack for problem-solving.Excellent architectural thinking to develop innovative solutions.Structured and critical thinking abilities to approach complex challenges.Strong interpersonal skills and alignment with our company culture.A collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a multicultural environment.
Globalpraxis is a renowned international consulting firm known for our blend of academic expertise and dedicated consultants who foster objectivity, creativity, and intellectual rigor. With a strong presence in consumer goods, telecommunications, transportation, pharmaceuticals, and service industries, our strategies in consumer engagement, distribution channels, and customer-centricity have propelled our clients toward global success. With a global reach spanning Europe, Asia, Africa, and the United States, we combine analytical rigor with local insights to become the perfect partner for businesses worldwide.
Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to make a lasting impact on businesses and launch your career forward. Apply now to be a part of our exciting and vibrant team at Globalpraxis!

title: Data Analyst
description:
About The Job
Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in.
Danone’s mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.
Danette, Evian, Activia, Volvic, Blédina, sound familiar to you? Do you know that behind these brands there is always Information Technology pushing them forward?
At Danone, we use advanced and innovative IT solutions which are implemented in all Danone units around the world to contribute to our mission bringing health through food to as many people as possible. Don’t wait, click and discover the Danone IS/IT universe and join the movement your IT skills could be a real asset for the alimentation revolution!
https//youtu.be/MqjF1HxsTyw
About You
Profile & Experience
 Minimum of 5-6 years’ experience in the Data & Analytics Domain.  Minimum of 1 -2 years’ experience as Functional or Business Analyst in a product team.  Proven Track record of Implementing efficient and flexible dashboards / reports / data visualization capabilities.  Ability to demonstrate a mix of technical skills and business processes knowledge and proven experience in rolling out a data product in multiple markets. Essential to have experience in experience in data catalogue documentation and manage the product use throughout all the stages of the product lifecycle.  Experience working with Data Architects, Ingestion, Data scientists, Developers and visualization teams in an agile framework.  Strong ability to connect and communicate to distinct stakeholders in a complex organization, managing stakeholders from Global, Local, Business and IT colleagues.  Experience implementing modern data strategies and solutions using cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, Google), Informatica Cloud, Power BI or similar tools. 
Competencies
 A minimum of a Bachelor's /Masters Degree is required; a field in Computer Science, Math, or statistical background.  Excellent level in SQL-like languages (SQL, Python, NOSQL, …), data warehousing(Snowflake/ redshift/ others) Feeling comfortable with the implementation of dashboards with the main reporting tools in the industry (PowerBI / SpotfIre / Kibana etc., or equivalent) Good knowledge and curiosity about best-in-class Data technologies Experienced in Functional Analysis/ Business Analysis / Data Analysis Proficiency in English Comfortable with written and verbal communication - strong analytic mind Capability to express complex data concepts into lay language for stakeholder management
About Us
As a Data Analyst, you will be our eyes in the ocean of data. We expect you to run experiments and studies to find quantitative answers from simple to more complex business or internal questions, having an easy access, and critical view on our data. This role will help the team to have a good control on the content of the data, the consistency, the quality, and should be able to provide deeper insights into the data.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to take the responsibility of designing the specification required for the developments we will plan to find the right data sources, how to transform them, how to analyze & provide insights, while ensuring the functional tests/validations, and creating the definition of done and make sure it is reached, together with the Product Owners.
We are looking for a candidate who has a strong knowledge on both data analyze/querying Data using SQL/ Python, visualizing through PowerBI and a good experience in turning the business needs into analytical insights and provide recommendations to the business with problem solving techniques.
In this position you will be reponsible for
Data Analysis Expertise
Data Analysis querying and exploit the data sets, tables, read and define the right data marts, navigate into the different environment (DWH, Datalakes, etc.) and extract relevant data for businessData Based Decision & Advices know how to leverage the quantitative insight from the data while keeping a critical eye to the content/reliability/information provided. Answering questions, providing precise insights or order of magnitudes easily. Data visualization represent the data insights in synthetic / tailor made dashboards and reports (Power BI, and/or other standard Business Intelligence tools)
Product Support to Data Governance
Knowledge Management keeping an up-to-date documentation / data & metadata description and linking it with the Data Excellence/Master Data Management program and MDM tools. Monitoring Being proactive in the definition of the data quality KPIs to ensure a well monitored data quality level. 
Implementation Follow-Up and Operationel Excellence
Backlog Gather and refine the backlog of user’s stories/requirements and ensure the right execution of the priorities set by the Product Owners & Senior Product Owners. Turn business needs into deliverablesThe description, documentation, and functional tests of new features to be done. Define the rules to validate the expected implementation of the features / User’s Stories (Definition Of Done)Validate the deliveries with the right quality/non-regression level. MVPs Maximizes efficiency in a constantly evolving environment using Minimal Viable Product delivery, and rapid prototyping. Keep a flexible/agile state of mind, while managing the backlog transparently and efficiently and communicating regularly on the progresses. 
Experience in developing innovative data solutions, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, and collaborating with small agile delivery teams are critical to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is important that you possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to logically analyse complex requirements or processes.
You will be a passionate with the ability to gain business partner agreement, communicate confidently at both the technical and data team level, and collaborate with a wide variety of technical and non-technical teams

title: Senior marketing Data Analyst
description: En los últimos años todo ha cambiado mucho, pero las marcas siguen persiguiendo lo mismo de siempre: llegar a las audiencias y conectar con ellas de forma eficaz. Lo que con la televisión era relativamente sencillo, ahora se ha vuelto más complejo que nunca.Hemos pasado de un ecosistema basado en medios masivos a un ecosistema fragmentado donde las audiencias están cada vez más atomizadas y donde es más difícil que nunca captar la atención y ser relevante. Así como esta transformación implica un cambio de mentalidad en el enfoque creativo y estratégico de la comunicación, también supone una nueva manera de entender la medición y el impacto de la efectividad publicitaria. Integrar datos de diferentes plataformas, trabajar con creadores de contenido, saber qué se está diciendo de tu marca en RRSS, medir la efectividad del contenido y no solo de spots, entender la atención en cada canal… Nuestro cliente lleva años defendiendo un modelo de medición que responda a este nuevo contexto. Es por eso que busca a alguien como tú. Un/a Senior Marketing Data Analyst que les ayude a hacer crecer el negocio de sus clientes a través de los datos.  FUNCIONESRecopilación y análisis de datos: Recopilar datos relacionados con las actividades de comunicación de la agencia, como campañas publicitarias, social listening, post tests de campaña, indicadores de salud de marca. Luego, analizar estos datos utilizando herramientas y técnicas estadísticas para obtener información significativa. Identificación de patrones y tendencias: Examinar los datos recopilados para identificar patrones, tendencias y relaciones. Realizar análisis de comportamiento de la audiencia y análisis de rendimiento de campañas para comprender mejor el impacto de las estrategias de comunicación. Generación de informes y visualización de datos: Comunicar los hallazgos y las conclusiones a través de informes y visualizaciones de datos claros y comprensibles utilizando herramientas de visualización de datos para crear gráficos, tablas y dashboards que faciliten la interpretación de los resultados. Evaluación de la efectividad: Medir el rendimiento de las actividades de comunicación, el rendimiento de las campañas, el impacto en la marca y el efecto en las ventas. Esta evaluación ayuda a identificar qué estrategias y tácticas son exitosas y cuáles deben ser ajustadas o modificadas. Optimización de estrategias de marketing: Utilizando los datos recopilados y los hallazgos obtenidos, colabora con el cliente y con el equipo interno de la agencia, especialmente departamento de cuentas, creativo, estrategia y de medios, para optimizar las estrategias y tácticas. Presentación de Resultados:Una vez se han sacado conclusiones explicaras los resultados y las conclusiones al cliente para poder tomar acciones que permitan mejorar la estrategia de comunicación.  REQUISITOS Y HABILIDADESPara poder llevar a cabo tus funciones de manera óptima, es necesario que cuentes con las siguientes habilidades: · Licenciatura o grado relacionado con marketing, publicidad o análisis de datos· Conocimiento de aplicaciones como de Data Analysis, Machine Learning, SQL, estadísticas: definir cuáles· Capacidad analítica· Visión estratégica· Conocimientos relacionados con marketing y comunicación· Conocimientos relacionados con medios pagados· Predisposición buena para trabajar sobre objetivos a largo plazo· Capacidad de comunicación oral y escrita   ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?Ambiente de trabajo increíble, hacen todo lo posible para ser felices, la certificación Great Place to Work© que han obtenido los avala (Se trata de uno de los reconocimientos más prestigiosos en el ámbito de la gestión de personas y la estrategia de negocio tanto a nivel nacional como internacional que se otorga anualmente a los mejores empleadores del mundo). Beneficios sociales:BS: 35-40kPorque creemos en el talento y su desarrollo, la formación está muy presente: ofrecen desde capacitación técnica al desarrollo de competencias.Retribución flexible (restaurante, guardería, transporte, formación y salud) que te puede suponer un ahorro aproximado del 30% de lo invertido en estos servicios/productos.Acceso a una amplia red de gimnasios /centros de yoga con cuota subvencionada.Acceso al conocimiento (todo tipo de formaciones para el desarrollo personal y profesional, sesiones de inspiración).
